events.title: Birth of Charles Darwin
events.description: Charles Darwin, the influential English naturalist who developed the theory of evolution by natural selection, was born.
events.significance: Darwin's work fundamentally changed biology and our understanding of life on Earth.

events.title: Centennial of Abraham Lincoln's Birth
events.description: A nationwide celebration in the United States marked the 100th anniversary of the birth of Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the U.S.
events.significance: Honors the legacy of Lincoln, a key figure in American history and the abolition of slavery.

events.title: First Winter Olympic Games
events.description: The first Winter Olympics were held in Chamonix, France, officially known as the I Olympic Winter Games.
events.significance: Established the Winter Olympics as a major international sporting event.

events.title: Indonesia Becomes a UN Member
events.description: Indonesia was admitted as a member of the United Nations after gaining independence from Dutch colonial rule.
events.significance: Marked an important step in Indonesia's international recognition and sovereignty.

events.title: Vladimir Putin Appointed Prime Minister of Russia
events.description: Vladimir Putin was appointed Prime Minister of Russia by President Boris Yeltsin.
events.significance: Putin's rise marked a significant change in Russian politics, leading to long-term leadership.
